cyclone.name: IRMA
cyclone.current_location: between the north coast of Hispaniola and the Turks and Caicos Islands
cyclone.trajectory: Continuing west-northwest across the southeastern and central Bahamas through Friday, then expected to bend slightly northward toward South Florida during the weekend and climb up the eastern side of the Florida Peninsula toward Georgia/South-Carolina early next week

weather_observation.watch_coast: Jupiter Inlet southward around the Florida peninsula to Bonita Beach, including the Florida Keys, Lake Okeechobee, Florida Bay, and Cuba from Matanzas eastward to Guantanamo
weather_observation.warning_coast: Northern Dominican Republic, northern Haiti, Turks and Caicos, southeastern-central-northwestern Bahamas
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Hispaniola, Bahamas, Cuba, Florida peninsula, eventually Georgia and the Carolinas
weather_observation.wind: Breezy conditions with occasional gusts below gale force possible early next week as Irma’s outer circulation passes well east of the port
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer rain-bands may bring light to moderate rainfall (<2 inches) late Sunday into Monday
